item.title: How to create a successful email campaign
item.description: To ensure your marketing emails are read, prioritize the customer’s experience, advises GetResponse, a company specializing in online marketing tools. GetResponse CEO Simon Grabowski highlights three key elements for a successful email marketing strategy: Understanding Subscriber Behavior Analyze past email opens and clicks to gain insights into your subscribers’ interests, email habits, and peak engagement times. Optimizing for Device Preferences With over 40% of emails being deleted due to poor mobile optimization, it’s crucial to tailor content for different devices.

item.title: Tips for achieving success with your startup
item.description: Thinking about launching a business from your great idea? Fabian Vandenreydt, a leader at Innotribe and the SWIFT Institute, who has witnessed the ups and downs of fintech startups, highlights key success factors. First, clearly define the problem you’re addressing and ensure it’s a genuine issue. Developing a fantastic product is futile without a problem to solve. Vandenreydt emphasizes that starting with a problem is crucial for success. Second, articulate a detailed solution implementation plan and understand your target market.

item.title: Before you start shopping online, be sure to check out Trend Micro's shopping tips
item.description: E-commerce is rising in Singapore and the surrounding region, with experts predicting the online retail market in ASEAN countries could expand by as much as 25% each year until 2017. While online shopping provides advantages like quick (and often free) delivery, and saves time, energy, and money, it also carries significant, frequently disregarded risks. Trend Micro cautions that these threats range from cybercriminals to online fraudsters targeting consumers’ personal data and finances.

item.title: Avoid Payroll and Tips at all costs!
item.description: While I’m not a fan of handling payroll, tips, sales tax, and analytical accounting, I recently discovered something interesting in Dynamics GP. Tax-sheltered deductions (TSAs) can affect how tips are taxed. Let’s look at an example: We have Adam Smith, an employee paid hourly with a rate of $15/hr. He also earns tips and has a tax-sheltered health deduction of $10 per pay period, exempt from federal and FICA taxes.

item.title: Visa introduces Visa Business Hub to assist small and medium-sized businesses with technology and strategic planning
item.description: Visa has launched the Visa Business Hub, a platform designed to assist small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) in navigating technology and improving their management practices. The hub, initially launched in Singapore and Malaysia, offers software-as-a-service (SaaS) solutions that can potentially reduce IT costs by up to 25% through a pay-as-you-use model. This approach minimizes upfront expenses and implementation time. Research indicates that a significant number of businesses in Singapore (80%) view SaaS/cloud adoption as a strategic move rather than a passing trend.
